description: The story takes place on an island, where a "Fractale System" is beginning to collapse. One day, Clain finds an injured girl called Phryne under a cliff. She disappears leaving a pendant. Clain sets out for a journey with the girl-shaped avatar Nessa to look for Phryne and discovers the secret of the Fractale System.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Aviation
tags.description: Regarding the flying or operation of aircraft.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ccarrollbeard) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/colleen.clinkenbeardvoiceactress)

An American voice actress and theatre actress, working mainly in the commercial and dubbing industries. She has also served as ADR director, line producer, and script writer for several anime titles for Funimation.

She gave birth to her first son, Rhodes Vandelo Carroll, on September 4, 2014.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masuyama56)

Married to [Yuka Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/124580/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masuyama56)

Married to [Yuka Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/124580/).
Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.
Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yamacane0901/) | [Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/kanku0901/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcZ_aVrm0ux7Jw2G5jgq6Gw/)

Yutaka Yamamoto is a director, scriprtwriter, lyricist and storyboarder. Infamous for his incendiary behavior on Twitter and for having been fired from [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) and [Ordet](https://anilist.co/studio/334/), the latter of which he helped co-found. 

As a member of Kyoto Animation, he rose to prominence within the company after serving as assistant director on [Munto 2: Beyond the Walls of Time](https://anilist.co/anime/1135/). In 2006, he was selected to be the chief episode director of [The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/), after which he became well known among anime fans for the ending dance theme he choreographed. He was to make his full directorial debut with [Lucky Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1887/), but was replaced after four episodes due to "performance issues." In a later radio interview, Yamamoto confirmed he was fired by Kyoto Animation and unsuccessfully attempted to win back his job. 

Yamamoto has threatened to quit his career in anime production six times over the years. In May 2019, Yamamoto vowed never to "work on anything related to animation again" after finishing [Hakubo](https://anilist.co/anime/98784/). He has become notorious for his incendiary behavior on Twitter, including calling fans of anime "mentally disabled," discriminatory remarks about Chinese and Korean anime fans, and attacking his former cast members, which resulted in him being temporarily suspended from Twitter in 2018.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/235154812) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/30949)

Started out as amateur gif animator before turning professional. He initially failed an examination test for [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) but was later scouted by the late [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/) for [Beck](https://anilist.co/anime/57/). There he met noted animators [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/), the former which he would work with on numerous occasions afterwards.

His breakthrough as an animator was on [Noein](https://anilist.co/anime/584/), a series directed by [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/). The 12th episode was highly regarded by animation fans and other animators for the given display by him and Matsumoto. He would later also serve as a character designer on [Birdy the Mighty: Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/), another series directed by Akane.

His dedication for animation could also be seen on [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/), for which he animated a minute-long scene of the main character running down a street. He went on the actual street in Tokyo to film himself for reference footage for the cut.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BC%8A%E6%9D%B1%E4%BC%B8%E9%AB%98)

Best known for his individual designs outside of the industry's norm.

Originating from Studio Dove. Itou started as an in-betweener on [Zettai Muteki Raijin Ou](https://anilist.co/anime/1897/) and made his debut as a character designer on the series [Kemonozume](https://anilist.co/anime/1454/), directed by [Masaaki Yuasa](https://anilist.co/staff/100068/). He has since designed the characters for most of Yuasa's works.

He has since designed the characters for most of Yuasa's works.

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomohikoito0218)

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2256470167)

After graduating from high school, Kubota went through training at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s research center before dropping out and joining [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1998. Three years later in he met [Sushio](https://anilist.co/staff/103619/) at Comiket, which led to Kubota joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he made his debut as an animation director on the premiere of [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/277/)'s second season.

In 2005, he made his debut as a character designer, although still jointly together with Sushio and [Takaaki Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/110187/), on the 6th [One Piece](https://anilist.co/anime/464/) movie. The film was directed by Mamoru Hosoda, which led to Kubota getting an invite to join the production of [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/) as an animation director. After this he kept working at Gainax until going freelance.

In 2012, he worked as the main character designer on [From the New World](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/) and [Robotics;Notes](https://anilist.co/anime/13599/), and a few years later he served as one on [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/), which earned him international fame.
Souhei Kanno is a Japanese composer born in Yokohama, Japan. He graduated from the Tokyo College of Music in 2004, and in 2011 he composed the music for the TV anime Fractale.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/115874632) | [Website](leftside.info/index.html)

Hidari is a Japanese illustrator and character designer. He is primarily known as an illustrator for video games and light novels. Some of his notable designs for anime include [Fractale](https://anilist.co/anime/9314/) and [Natsuiro Kiseki](https://anilist.co/anime/12119/) and for PS3 game Atelier Ayesha, and best known light novel illustrations are for [Sasami-san@Ganbaranai](https://anilist.co/manga/69349/).

His pseudonym and circle "Left Side" comes from the fact that he predominantly uses his left hand.

He was awarded third place in the 2010 “Kono Light Novel ga Sugoi!” illustrator ranking.

__Notable works outside anime:__

- Atelier Ayesha: The Alchemist of Dusk (Video Game, 2012) (Character Illustration / Character Designing, Illustration)
- Atelier Escha & Logy: Alchemists of the Dusk Sky (Video Game, 2014) (Character Illustration / Designing)
- Atelier Shallie: Alchemists of the Dusk Sea (Video Game, 2014) (Character Illustration / Character Designing)
- Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia (Video Game, 2017) (Character Design & Illustration)
- Record of Lodoss War: Deedlit in Wonder Labyrinth (Video Game, 2020) (Character Drafts)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnsama) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/75255)
